value.title: Can AI Nudge People To Live Healthier Lives?
value.excerpt: Clinicians and health plans can't compel someone to come in for a check-up or eat healthier food. But while health plans may lack the authority to compel action, that doesn't mean they lack effective means to encourage good behaviors.

value.title: Alexa is getting chattier as Amazon’s AI guesses what you really wanted

value.title: Top Reasons The Investment Spigot Is Reopening For Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: Recent spate of investments in self-driving cars is due to key factors that are dovetailing at this moment in time.

value.title: Pope Francis Wants You to Pray for Ethical Robots
value.excerpt: There’s a lot of folks worried about the ethics and future of AI and robotics. Apparently, you can count Pope Francis among them.

value.title: Honda claims it'll be the first to mass produce level 3 self-driving cars

value.title: AI research finds a ‘compute divide’ concentrates power and accelerates inequality in the era of deep learning
value.excerpt: The analysis reviews papers accepted for publication at large AI conferences such as ACL, ICML, and NeurIPS in categories like computer vision, data mining, machine learning, and NLP.

value.title: Police in London Face Legal Action Over Cancelled Trans Rights Protest
value.excerpt: The organisers of a protest were threatened with arrest, despite being a political group that had taken health and safety measures.

value.title: People suffering depression and anxiety want to reveal their pain — to a robot
value.excerpt: A majority of workers are more comfortable sharing their mental health struggles with a robot than a boss. Experts are divided on whether AI is up to the task.

value.title: Researchers claim AI algorithm uses heart rate and motion data to predict age, sex, and more
value.excerpt: University of Cambridge and Alan Turing Institute researchers developed an algorithm that predicts age, BMI, and more from wearable data.

value.title: Equitable tech: AI-enabled platform to reduce bias in datasets released
value.excerpt: The platform could promote equity in academic admissions, credit score assessment, hiring, academic admissions, and more, according to Synthesized.

value.title: Researchers Propose ‘Physical AI’ As Key To Lifelike Robots
value.excerpt: This combined discipline of "physical AI" could effectively be the missing link in the attempt to create artificially intelligent robots that look and behave like humans, the Imperial College London team suggests.

value.title: DeepMind would have 'probably failed' without Google, says early investor
value.excerpt: Founding DeepMind investor Humayun Sheikh told CNBC that the London AI lab would have "probably failed" if Google hadn't bought it.

value.title: How The Future Of Deep Learning Could Resemble The Human Brain
value.excerpt: Just as our brains evolve early in our lives, AI should evolve as we increasingly apply it in real-world scenarios at scale.

value.title: Google wants you to help train its AI by labeling images in Google Photos
value.excerpt: By identifying these objects you’re training AI to do the same. The feature appears in the most recent version of Google Photos. Just tap on the search button in the app’s menu, scroll down, and you’ll see an option to “Help improve Google Photos.

value.title: Intel debuts GPU for the data centre with a focus on Android cloud gaming
value.excerpt: Intel has debuted its first discrete graphics processing unit (GPU) for the data centre, Intel Server GPU, which is based on the Xe-LP architecture and is designed specifically for high-density, low-latency Android cloud gaming and media streaming.

value.title: Microsoft is partnering with Qualcomm to enhance AI and ML developer experience
value.excerpt: Microsoft and Qualcomm are partnering to improve the development and deployment experience for developers using the respective technologies offered by the two firms to build AI and ML solutions.

value.title: India bets on AI tech to curb coronavirus infections, amid privacy fears
value.excerpt: In India, dozens of data-driven solutions have emerged to track people’s movements, check temperatures and enforce social distancing, sparking privacy fears.

value.title: Josh.ai launches a ‘nearly invisible’ Amazon Echo competitor that’s the size of a coin

value.title: Education key to developing lifelike intelligent robots, study argues
value.excerpt: In a new paper, researchers argue artificial intelligence has been too narrowly defined and biased by human hubris. To rectify this shortcoming, the study's authors claim robot-makers need to be better educated.
